variants.Description in input context: A30P, a mutation associated with early-onset familial Parkinson's disease.
A53T, a mutation associated with early-onset familial Parkinson's disease, showing enhanced inhibition of PLD2.

Material used.Description: hPLD2 was expressed in Sf9 cells using a baculovirus construct and purified for the assay.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P inhibition of PLD2 was not different from wild-type a-synuclein.
A53T mutant showed greater inhibitory effect on PLD2 compared to wild-type a-synuclein.

Biological replicates.Description: Means and standard deviations for three or four separate experiments are shown in the results.

Technical replicates.Description: No specific mention of technical replicates in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type a-synuclein was used as a reference for comparison with mutants.

Basic negative control.Description: hPLD2 activity was measured in the absence of a-synuclein as a baseline control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Analysis of covariates (ANCOVA) using the General Linear Model to compare slopes between proteins, performed with SAS software.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Inhibition similar to wild-type a-synuclein, with slope of inhibitory curve not significantly different from wild-type.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in inhibitory curve slope compared to wild-type a-synuclein, indicating enhanced or reduced inhibition.

Material used.Description: CD spectra were collected for hAS and mutants DYD and S129E in the presence of lipid vesicles.

Readout description.Result Description: No specific results for A30P in circular dichroism spectroscopy mentioned in the literature.
No specific results for A53T in circular dichroism spectroscopy mentioned in the literature.

Biological replicates.Description: No specific mention of biological replicates for circular dichroism spectroscopy in the literature.

Technical replicates.Description: No specific mention of technical replicates for circular dichroism spectroscopy in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type hAS was used as a reference for comparison with mutants.

Basic negative control.Description: No specific negative control mentioned for circular dichroism spectroscopy.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: a-helix content similar to wild-type hAS (approximately 77%) in the presence of lipid vesicles.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in a-helix content compared to wild-type hAS in the presence of lipid vesicles.
